subject: Re: [junit] How can I test an Exception
msgSnippet: On Fri, 24 Sep 2004 03:35:01 -0000, Weiming YIN ... try { thisShouldThrowExceptionIWant(); fail( Did not throw ExceptionIWant ); catch( ExceptionIWant e) {}
messageBody:
On Fri, 24 Sep 2004 03:35:01 -0000, Weiming YIN
<yinweiming@...> wrote:
> Hi,all :
> I am a frech man of Junit, and I have a question.
> How can I test a case which I want it throws an exception.
>
> How can I test the Exception is the one I expected.


try {
thisShouldThrowExceptionIWant();
fail( "Did not throw ExceptionIWant" );
catch( ExceptionIWant e) {}


and of course your test case declares that it throws Exception - so
that if anything else is thrown, the test runner reports it as an
error.
